#Text=Waterval Boven
#Text=Waterval
#Text=Boven
#Text=is a city in Mpumalanga .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Waterval Boven is a small country village situated on the Transvaal Drakensberg Escarpment smack bang in the middle of Mpumalanga province .
#Text=The town started out in the early 1890s when the steep gradients called for tunnels and bridges to be built for the line between Pretoria and Delagoa Bay ( Maputo ) . '
#Text=Boven 's main industry was the railway operations until the 1990s when operations were scaled down .
#Text=The town was named after the 75 m Elands River Waterval just outside town .
#Text=The translation from the old Dutch is " Above the waterfall " .
#Text=This is only one of the waterfalls nestled in the valleys surrounding ' Boven .
#Text=Today Waterval Boven is a retreat for rock climbers , mountain bikers , fly fishermen and anybody who just wants to enjoy nature and the slow rhythm of country life .
#Text=Get in
#Text=From Johannesburg
#Text=Follow the N1 towards Pretoria .
#Text=Make sure you stay on the left just after exit 112 ( Brakfontein/Old Pretoria road ) as the N1 and N14 will meet and you need to keep following the N1 through the Brakfontein Interchange .
#Text=For some unknown reason the speed limit between exit 128 ( John Foster ) and exit 136 ( Rigel Ave ) is 100km/h rather than the usual 120km/h .
#Text=There are static cameras , so make sure you do n't exceed the limit .
#Text=Continue following the N1 until it meets the N4 at the Proefplaas Interchange , shortly after exit 141 ( M6 Lynwood Rd ) , keep to the left and follow the N4 Witbank signs .
#Text=From here , follow the directions as from Pretoria .
#Text=From Pretoria
#Text=Take the N4 east towards Witbank .
#Text=This is a toll road in very good condition and average driving time will be around 1 hour .
#Text=Toll cost is R18 at the Diamond Hill toll gate ( about halfway between Pretoria and Witbank ) .
#Text=Keep an eye open for an impressive swallows nest construction ( thousands of nests build from mud ) covering the underside of one of the overpasses on this road .
#Text=You will reach the Middelburg toll gate shortly after passing through Witbank .
#Text=Stay on the N4 and pass by Belfast on your way to Machadodorp .
#Text=If you need to take a break from driving and stretch your legs , stop at Milly 's just before Macahodorp .
#Text=You will also notice that the speed limit is reduced as you enter Machadodorp , so make sure you keep below the posted speeds as there are always speed traps .
#Text=Shortly after passing through Machadodorp you will reach the Machado toll gate .
#Text=Be aware that you might encounter heavy fog between Witbank and Machadodorp during the winter months .
#Text=Look out for the Waterval Boven turn-off on th right .
#Text=Do
#Text=Rock climbers discovered the quartzite cliffs of the area in 1991 and Waterval Boven has since become a major attraction to the domestic and international climbing community .
#Text=With over 600 sport routes and a 150 traditional lines there is enough climbing to make you come back for more .
#Text=Mountain Bikers can enjoy a number of single tracks in the area offering excellent riding and panoramic views .
#Text=Other activities in the area include hiking , horse riding , fly fishing and bird watching .
#Text=Fly fisherman can choose between stocked dams as well as river fishing .
#Text=The river below the falls is home to an endemic yellow fish species and for that reason not stocked with trout .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The Stone Circle Bistro offers good meals in a beautiful riverfront setting .
#Text=Kaizer Chicken Dust situated in Emgwenya Township offers excellent flame-grilled chicken .
#Text=Drink
#Text=The Stone Circle Bistro is a fully licenced restaurant .
#Text=The Shamrock Arms is an Irish Pub .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Accommodation on offer ranges from luxury lodges to backpacker style budget accommodation .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Kruger National Park
#Text=Johannesburg and Pretoria are roughly 2 hours drive away
